definition: out of ammunition and no food left (idiom); in desperate straits
to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)
crossball/bullet/shot/shell/ball
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
to the greatest extent/(when used before a noun of location) furthest or extreme/to be within the limits of/to give priority to
grain/food/provisions/agricultural tax paid in grain
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means
variant of 絕|绝[jue2]

sentences.english: As a result, they were surrounded by the army of Qin till the supplies were exhausted.
sentences.chinese: 结果，赵军被秦军包围，直至弹尽粮绝。

sentences.english: And then for eight days, they had nothing.
sentences.chinese: 随后的八天内，他们弹尽粮绝了。

sentences.english: The little scamp had tempted us to think these kind of weapons were no longer to be found in his artillery.
sentences.chinese: 这个家伙时常让我们错认为他的武器库早已弹尽粮绝。

sentences.english: The enemy yielded up that city when ammunition and food supplies were exhausted.
sentences.chinese: 敌人弹尽粮绝，被迫放弃那座城市。

definition: out of ammunition and no hope of reinforcements (idiom); in desperate straits
to run out of food
the few are no match for the many/heavily outnumbered/facing impossible odds (idiom)
mountain and river exhausted (idiom); at the end of the line/nowhere to go
utterly defeated/routed/crushed/to collapse (of army)
multitude of enemies, few friends (idiom from Mencius)/heavily outnumbered/beaten by the weight of numbers
riders tired and horses weary (idiom)/worn out/exhausted/spent/fatigued
troops in defeat like a landslide (idiom); a beaten army in total collapse
lit. the path exhausted, the end of the road (idiom); an impasse/in a plight with no way out/things have reached a dead end
to be at an impasse (idiom)/in a tight spot/at the end of one's rope/desperate
to stand a siege/trapped in a besieged city
the multitude against the few, a wide disparity (idiom from Mencius); heavily outnumbered/unequally matched/overwhelmed by weight of numbers
soldiers at the city walls (idiom); fig. at a critical juncture
total defeat of an army (idiom); fig. a complete wipeout
to retreat and defend/to withdraw and maintain one's guard
to besiege
